thread.section_title: Tottenham’s Mauricio Pochettino a contender to replace Unai Emery at PSG – Metro
thread.title: Tottenham’s Mauricio Pochettino a contender to replace Unai Emery at PSG
thread.title_full: Tottenham’s Mauricio Pochettino a contender to replace Unai Emery at PSG

author: markbrus88
title: Tottenham’s Mauricio Pochettino a contender to replace Unai Emery at PSG
text:
Unai Emery is a man under pressure after PSG’s shock defeat to Barcelona (Picture: Getty) Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino could reportedly be in contention for the Paris Saint-Germain job this summer as the Ligue 1 giants weigh up the future of Unai Emery.
Rumour Mill: our round-up of football gossip, rumours and speculation The French champions were dumped out of the Champions League in humiliating fashion this week as Barcelona thrashed them 6-1 to complete a remarkable comeback from losing 4-0 in the first leg of their last-16 tie.
PSG are now understood to be ready to consider Emery’s position at the club after an unconvincing start to life in the French capital this term.
Mauricio Pochettino is reportedly a leading candidate for PSG (Picture: Getty) According to the London Evening Standard , Pochettino could be a prime candidate to replace the Spaniard in the Parc des Princes dugout as the club have followed his progress for some time.
More: Football Chelsea v Man Utd preview: Odds stacked against Mourinho in revenge mission 
Is this really Wenger's LOWEST point? 5 more times the Arsenal boss looked doomed 
Manchester United enter race with Chelsea to sign Alexis Sanchez 
The Argentine tactician impressed a number of big sides during his stint at Southampton, and has continued to do so with some fine work at Spurs.
Still, Pochettino only recently signed a new contract to keep him at White Hart Lane until 2021, and it is reported that Tottenham are keen to resist any interest in their manager.
Manchester United have also been linked with an interest in Pochettino in the past, but PSG could now be in need of a new manager if Emery doesn’t turn things around by the end of the season.
MORE: On the day Chelsea get stadium permission, Tottenham point out how near their own is to completion
